result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dequevon S Hardy

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dequevon S Hardy in court.  Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court for Dequevon S Hardy.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State, but requests additional time to meet with the State to discuss alternative options for resolution. Court finds good cause to adjourn this matter.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Dequevon S Hardy appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher J. Cherella appeared by video for Dequevon S Hardy.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Shorewood PD Detective A. Rekeuski.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 09.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Court orders that any cash bail posted be returned to the remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.

Defendant Dequevon S Hardy in court.  Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court for Dequevon S Hardy.  Prosecuting attorney Jack T Eichorst in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Van Grunsven, Branch 09. Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 079164,
Payable Number: 1026657,
Receipt Number: 22RP033180,
Amount: $20.00
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 9/12/2022 @1pm.
